channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition

item.title: Beirut will never be the same again
The explosion created a 405-foot crater
Satellite images show Beirut port before and after explosion
Trump still not grasping the severity of the pandemic, source tells CNN
Watch President Trump's interview on Axios
item.description: President Trump sat down with Axios reporter Jonathan Swan to discuss a wide variety of topics including the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: Fauci: US will continue to smolder if there's no unified response
Top Senate Republican pushes back against Trump's claims on mail-in-voting
Trump trashes Obama's Lewis eulogy that pressed for voting rights
item.description: President Donald Trump said Wednesday that former President Barack Obama's eulogy at John Lewis' funeral -- which at points was aimed at voting rights and the election -- was "terrible," adding that "It showed his anger there that people don't see."

item.title: Joe Biden will no longer travel to Milwaukee to accept Democratic nomination
Trump's claim leaves Anderson Cooper astonished
item.description: CNN's Anderson Cooper takes President Donald Trump to task for saying the 160,000 US coronavirus deaths "is what it is" and saying Covid-19 is under control.

item.title: 'May karma find you all': Obituary condemns Trump and people who don't wear masks
item.description: Stacey Nagy's husband, David, died two weeks ago from coronavirus complications. She grieved the loss of her longtime love. And then she fumed.

item.title: Neil Young sues Trump's reelection campaign
item.description: Rock & Roll legend Neil Young has sued President Donald Trump's reelection campaign for copyright infringement over its use of two songs at the President's political rallies and events.

item.title: The island, the bomber, the blast: Hiroshima after 75 years
Texas scientist and mother of two killed during her regular morning run
item.description: A 43-year-old scientist and mother of two was found dead near a creek in Plano, Texas, on Saturday morning after going out for her regular morning run, police said.

item.title: Why a giant Hindu deity is appearing on Times Square -- and why it's so controversial
The purpose of this odd flying metal cylinder that SpaceX launched
item.description: SpaceX launched an experimental rocket prototype on a "hop test" this week during which the giant tank-like vehicle — reminiscent of an old metal grain silo — soared nearly 500 feet above ground before touching down safely on a nearby ground pad.

item.title: Primary results: 4 takeaways from Tuesday's elections
item.description: While President Donald Trump's plummeting approval rating during the coronavirus pandemic continue to imperil Republican campaigns for Congress, the GOP establishment had a few reasons to cheer on Tuesday.

item.title: New York mayor responds to health commissioner's resignation
item.description: New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio responds to the resignation of Oxiris Barbot, the city's health commissioner, who helped lead efforts to contain Covid-19.

item.title: US health chief to make most senior visit to Taiwan in decades
item.description: United States Health and Human Services Secretary Alex Azar will lead a delegation to Taiwan, his office announced Tuesday, in a high-level trip that is almost certain to anger Beijing, which claims the self-governing island as part of its territory.

item.title: Cyclone Isaias moves into Canada after killing 5 on US east coast
item.description: Isaias, now a post-tropical cyclone, has moved into southeastern Canada, bringing heavy rain and powerful winds over the province of Quebec.

item.title: HSBC bet the bank on China. It's in big trouble if tensions escalate
An event that brings thousands of tourists to a small South Dakota city is about to begin
item.description: Despite objections from a majority of its residents, a South Dakota city is preparing to host what some locals say is the largest gathering of motorcycle enthusiasts in the world.

item.title: US obesity epidemic could undermine effectiveness of a Covid-19 vaccine
Trump Jr. opposes controversial Alaska mine that could disrupt critical salmon fishery
item.description: Donald Trump Jr. and Vice President Mike Pence's former top aide are calling on the Trump administration to block a controversial gold and copper mine proposed in Alaska that the Obama administration said would cause permanent damage to a critical salmon fishery.

item.title: Hear from parents torn over sending kids back to school
item.description: CNN's Miguel Marquez talks to four parents from the same school district in Arizona about sending their children back to school during the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: How a grandmother from Nigeria ended up in Beyoncé's 'Black Is King'
item.description: Mojisola Odegbami did not anticipate that a trip to the United States would land her a part in a visual album by one of the most popular music artists in the world -- Beyoncé.

item.title: NYC party boat owners arrested after their cruise was busted with more than 170 guests on board
item.description: A riverboat party attended by more than 170 people in New York over the weekend violated state and city emergency orders, according to the New York City Sheriff's Office.

item.title: Police say man shot at a store's employee after dispute over masks
item.description: A Pennsylvania man is facing charges of attempted criminal homicide after he allegedly shot at an employee of a cigar shop who asked him to wear a mask.

item.title: Megan Rapinoe says 'we all have a responsibility to make the world a better place'
item.description: Megan Rapinoe has always been about goals, both the scoring and achieving of them.

item.title: Jason Momoa surprises Lisa Bonet by restoring her old Mustang
item.description: Jason Momoa has just upstaged all husbands amid the pandemic.

item.title: Covid-19 victim's husband explains why he took off his PPE in final moments
item.description: ICU Dr. Joseph Costa died after battling Covid-19. His husband, David Hart, remembers his emotional final moments as staff throughout the ICU gathered to say goodbye.

item.title: Satellite imagery reveals new penguin colonies in Antarctica
item.description: Satellite imaging has revealed that there are nearly 20% more emperor penguin colonies in Antarctica than previously thought.

item.title: CNN Style looks back on six decades of Dolly Parton
item.description: For over six decades, on stage and screen, Dolly Parton's look has remained unmistakable. CNN Style looks back.

item.title: 'Big Brother' returns with color-coded pods and no hugs amid coronavirus pandemic
item.description: "Big Brother" Season 22 kicks off tonight with an all-star group of returning contestants, cast and crew taking extra precautions amid the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: How safe is a road trip home to see the family?
item.description: "I didn't look at our drive as a vacation or a trip," says Christy Frank, who drove 10 hours with her three children from Copake, New York, to her hometown of Tiffin, Ohio. "We were just trying to get across the state to do exactly what we were doing at home, but at my parents' house."

item.title: One pilot brings the world to Iceland
item.description: Ancient tales of trolls and magic live on in Iceland, an island nation of volcanoes, lava fields, glaciers and ice caves.

item.title: Artist tells the story behind her New Yorker cover portrait of Sojourner Truth
item.description: When the New Yorker asked me to illustrate the cover of their new August issue commemorating 100 years of women's suffrage in America, I chose to depict 19th-century activist Sojourner Truth. Truth was an early advocate for Black women's rights who didn't live to see the fruits of her labor. I wanted to point out that while White women gained the right to vote in 1920, it would still take another 45 years -- until the Voting Rights Act of 1965 -- for women of color to be able to cast their ballots.

item.title: How this $61 million man awakened a sleeping giant
item.description: There hasn't been much to shout about at Manchester United over the last few years.

item.title: Exploding stars created the calcium in our bones and teeth, study says
item.description: The calcium in our bones and teeth likely came from stars exploding in supernovas and scattering this mineral across the universe in massive quantities, according to a new study.

item.title: How 'gym rat' Brooks Koepka is bucking golf's trends
item.description: "He loves working out; He's a gym rat; He hits the ball a mile," are some of the ways Brooks Koepka has been characterized by a number of golf writers and commentators.

item.title: Google Doodle promotes mask wearing and social distancing practices
item.description: Google is chiming into the Covid-19 discourse using a "Google Doodle" to emphasize the importance of wearing a mask. Their homepage is featuring a Google logo that shows each letter doing its part and following the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention guidelines.

item.title: A rare winter wonderland blanketed Tasmania, and residents couldn't get enough
item.description: A rare event this week kept residents in northern Tasmania, Australia, up all night: snowflakes falling.

item.title: Durian fruit: A smell so rotten, a taste so sweet
item.description: Durian has been described as the most foul-smelling fruit in the world. Its aroma has been compared to raw sewage, rotting flesh and smelly gym socks. Durian's smell is so pungent that the spiky-skinned, custard-like fruit is even banned from public places in Singapore and Malaysia. But for its fans, there is nothing better in this world.

item.title: As a massive explosion ripped through Beirut, its people seemed to have finally been rendered powerless
item.description: Beirut has long been synonymous with the word explosion. The city was the main flashpoint of Lebanon's 15-year civil war, one of the world's longest. And in the last 15 years alone, it has witnessed a string of assassinations, a days-long civil conflict, a month-long international war, and years of economic and political turmoil.

item.title: See what bomb expert thinks caused Beirut explosion
item.description: An ex-British Army explosive expert says the explosion in Beirut, Lebanon, shows the tell-tale signs of an ammonium nitrate explosion. CNN's Sam Kiley reports.

item.title: Tons of explosive material emerges as possible blast source
item.description: A warehouse storing thousands of tons of unsecured highly explosive material has emerged as a possible source of the massive blast that ripped through the Lebanese capital on Tuesday, killing nearly 80 people, injuring 4,000 and sending a shock wave across the city that damaged buildings and blew out windows up to 10 kilometers (6 miles) away.

item.title: What is ammonium nitrate and why did it explode?
item.description: Lebanon's government has blamed a large quantity of poorly stored ammonium nitrate for the huge blast that rocked its capital, Beirut, killing scores of people and devastating swathes of the city. What is this chemical, and why did it explode?

item.title: A nurse pulled three newborns out of a hospital hit by blast
item.description: Photojournalist Bilal Jawich was at home on the outskirts of Beirut when an explosion, which has left at least 100 dead and thousands injured, rocked the Lebanese capital.

item.title: Esper: 'Most believe' it was an accident, despite Trump's claim
item.description: Defense Secretary Mark Esper said Wednesday that "most believe" that the explosion in Beirut "was an accident, as reported," despite President Donald Trump's claim a day prior that it was an attack.

item.title: Satellite images of explosion show massive crater at port
